body_html:
About 1 and 2: CUDA and cuDNN are software built by NVIDIA. Their installation instructions may change for reasons beyond our control.
Therefore instead of us rewriting NVIDIA's instructions to install their software, we elected to point to NVIDIA for latest instructions for these.

Mac GPU is actually a difficult environment to test, as Apple has not produced a mac with NVIDIA GPUs for three years now. I think there may be two bugs from what you described:
-Setting DYLD_LIBRARY_PATH does not work.
-We need to create a symlink to avoid a segfault (when loading cuda libraries)

I will investigate these two.

body:
About 1 and 2: CUDA and cuDNN are software built by NVIDIA. Their installation instructions may change for reasons beyond our control.
Therefore instead of us rewriting NVIDIA's instructions to install their software, we elected to point to NVIDIA for latest instructions for these.

Mac GPU is actually a difficult environment to test, as Apple has not produced a mac with NVIDIA GPUs for three years now. I think there may be two bugs from what you described:
-Setting `DYLD_LIBRARY_PATH` does not work.
-We need to create a symlink to avoid a segfault (when loading cuda libraries)

I will investigate these two.
